revised_title: Long-term Hazards of Man-made Chemicals in the Environment and Occupational Experience
tldr: This article discusses the long-term hazards of man-made chemicals in the environment and the importance of occupational experience in understanding disease causation. It highlights the challenges of using occupational information to study environmental impact and the difficulties in obtaining accurate exposure measurements. The article also explores the use of biological monitoring and the complexities of dose-response assessment. Examples of successful identification of hazards in the tar, dye, and vinyl chloride industries are provided, emphasizing the importance of considering both high and low exposures to chemicals.
